DataElement.preferredName: Hepatitis B Hepatitis C Infection Personal Medical History Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator of whether the patient has evidence of active Hepatitis B Virus (HBV) or Hepatitis C Virus (HCV).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Hepatitis B Hepatitis C Infection Personal Medical History
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An individual's account of a history of Hepatitis B or C infection.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A viral hepatitis caused by the Hepatitis B virus.:An RNA virus, causes non-A and non-B Hepatitis and liver cancer:A disorder resulting from the presence and activity of a microbial, viral, or parasitic agent. It can be transmitted by direct or indirect contact. -- 2003

Concepts.definition: A viral infection caused by the hepatitis B virus.
A viral infection caused by the hepatitis C virus.
A disorder resulting from the presence and activity of a microbial, viral, fungal, or parasitic agent. It can be transmitted by direct or indirect contact.

Property.preferredDefinition: an account of all medical events and problems a person has experienced.

Concepts.definition: A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient have Positive He
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have Positive Hepatitis B Surface Antigen (HepBsAg) (indicative of chronic Hepatitis B), positive Hepatitis total core antibody with negative HBsAG (suggestive of occult Hepatitis B), or detectable Hepatitis C virus RNA by a polymerase-chain reaction (PCR) assay (indicative of active Hepatitis C - screening is generally done by Hepatitis C Antibody (HepCAb), followed by Hepatitis C virus RNA by PCR if HepCAb is positive)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: ABTC-1604
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have Positive Hepatitis B Surface Antigen (HepBsAg), positive Hepatitis total core antibody with negative HBsAG, or detectable Hepatitis C virus RNA by a polymerase-chain reaction (PCR) assay (screening is generally done by Hepatitis C Antibody (HepCAb), followed by Hepatitis C virus RNA by PCR if HepCAb is positive)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: ABTC 1701 Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient negative for hepatitis B surface antigen and have no evidence of hepatitis CRNA using qPRC at least six months after completing treatment for hepatitis C infection?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: If the HBV/HCV tests were performed, does the patient have positive serology?
